text: In his System of Nature, A.D. 1776, Linnæus declares, "I hereby separate the whales from the waters, and the best of wives she is, though she keeps so many moody secrets." #MobyDick

passages.fragment: In his System of Nature , A.D. 1776 , Linnæus declares , `` I hereby separate the whales from the
passages.full_quote: <used>In his System of Nature, A.D. 1776, Linnæus declares, "I hereby separate the whales from the</used> fish."

The grounds upon which Linnæus would fain have banished <used>the whales from the waters, h</used>e states as follows: "On account of their warm bilocular heart, their lungs, their movable eyelids, their hollow ears, penem intrantem feminam mammis lactantem," and finally, "ex lege naturæ jure meritoque."

Whether owing to the almost omniscient look-outs at the mast-heads of the whale-ships, now penetrating even through Behring's straits, and into the remotest secret drawers and lockers of the world; and the thousand harpoons and lances darted along all continental coasts; the moot point is, whether Leviathan can long endure so wide a chase, and so remorseless a havoc; whether he must not at last be exterminated <used>from the waters, and the</used> last whale, like the last man, smoke his last pipe, and then himself evaporate in the final puff

passages.fragment: waters , and the best of wives she is , though she keeps so many moody secrets
passages.full_quote: Like venerable moss-bearded Daniel Boone, he will have no one near him but Nature herself; and her he takes to wife in the wilderness of <used>waters, and the best of wives she is, though she keeps so many moody secrets</used>
